knowledges_ids.K0001: Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies.

knowledges_ids.K0002: Knowledge of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk).

knowledges_ids.K0003: Knowledge of laws, regulations, policies, and ethics as they relate to cybersecurity and privacy.

knowledges_ids.K0004: Knowledge of cybersecurity and privacy principles.

knowledges_ids.K0005: Knowledge of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.

knowledges_ids.K0006: Knowledge of specific operational impacts of cybersecurity lapses.

knowledges_ids.K0072: Knowledge of resource management principles and techniques.

knowledges_ids.K0101: Knowledge of the organization's enterprise information technology (IT) goals and objectives.

knowledges_ids.K0127: Knowledge of the nature and function of the relevant information structure (e.g., National Information Infrastructure).

knowledges_ids.K0146: Knowledge of the organization's core business/mission processes.

knowledges_ids.K0147: Knowledge of emerging security issues, risks, and vulnerabilities.

knowledges_ids.K0168: Knowledge of applicable laws, statutes (e.g., in Titles 10,18,32,50 in U.S. Code), Presidential Directives, executive branch guidelines, and/or administrative/criminal legal guidelines and procedures.

knowledges_ids.K0169: Knowledge of information technology (IT) supply chain security and supply chain risk management policies, requirements, and procedures.

knowledges_ids.K0204: Knowledge of learning assessment techniques (rubrics, evaluation plans, tests, quizzes).

knowledges_ids.K0233: Knowledge of the National Cybersecurity Workforce Framework, work roles, and associated tasks, knowledge, skills, and abilities.

knowledges_ids.K0234: Knowledge of full spectrum cyber capabilities (e.g., defense, attack, exploitation).

knowledges_ids.K0241: Knowledge of organizational human resource policies, processes, and procedures.

knowledges_ids.K0243: Knowledge of organizational training and education policies, processes, and procedures.

knowledges_ids.K0309: Knowledge of emerging technologies that have potential for exploitation.

knowledges_ids.K0311: Knowledge of industry indicators useful for identifying technology trends.

knowledges_ids.K0313: Knowledge of external organizations and academic institutions with cyber focus (e.g., cyber curriculum/training and Research & Development).

knowledges_ids.K0335: Knowledge of current and emerging cyber technologies.

skills_ids.S0108: Skill in developing workforce and position qualification standards.

skills_ids.S0128: Skill in using manpower and personnel IT systems.

abilities_ids.A0023: Ability to design valid and reliable assessments.

abilities_ids.A0028: Ability to assess and forecast manpower requirements to meet organizational objectives.

abilities_ids.A0033: Ability to develop policy, plans, and strategy in compliance with laws, regulations, policies, and standards in support of organizational cyber activities.

abilities_ids.A0037: Ability to leverage best practices and lessons learned of external organizations and academic institutions dealing with cyber issues.

abilities_ids.A0042: Ability to develop career path opportunities.

abilities_ids.A0053: Ability to determine the validity of workforce trend data.

tasks_ids.T0001: Acquire and manage the necessary resources, including leadership support, financial resources, and key security personnel, to support information technology (IT) security goals and objectives and reduce overall organizational risk.

tasks_ids.T0004: Advise senior management (e.g., CIO) on cost/benefit analysis of information security programs, policies, processes, systems, and elements.

tasks_ids.T0025: Communicate the value of information technology (IT) security throughout all levels of the organization stakeholders.

tasks_ids.T0044: Collaborate with stakeholders to establish the enterprise continuity of operations program, strategy, and mission assurance.

tasks_ids.T0074: Develop policy, programs, and guidelines for implementation.

tasks_ids.T0094: Establish and maintain communication channels with stakeholders.

tasks_ids.T0099: Evaluate cost/benefit, economic, and risk analysis in decision-making process.

tasks_ids.T0222: Review existing and proposed policies with stakeholders.

tasks_ids.T0226: Serve on agency and interagency policy boards.

tasks_ids.T0341: Advocate for adequate funding for cyber training resources, to include both internal and industry-provided courses, instructors, and related materials.

tasks_ids.T0352: Conduct learning needs assessments and identify requirements.

tasks_ids.T0355: Coordinate with internal and external subject matter experts to ensure existing qualification standards reflect organizational functional requirements and meet industry standards.

tasks_ids.T0356: Coordinate with organizational manpower stakeholders to ensure appropriate allocation and distribution of human capital assets.

tasks_ids.T0362: Develop and implement standardized position descriptions based on established cyber work roles.

tasks_ids.T0363: Develop and review recruiting, hiring, and retention procedures in accordance with current HR policies.

tasks_ids.T0364: Develop cyber career field classification structure to include establishing career field entry requirements and other nomenclature such as codes and identifiers.

tasks_ids.T0365: Develop or assist in the development of training policies and protocols for cyber training.

tasks_ids.T0368: Ensure that cyber career fields are managed in accordance with organizational HR policies and directives.

tasks_ids.T0369: Ensure that cyber workforce management policies and processes comply with legal and organizational requirements regarding equal opportunity, diversity, and fair hiring/employment practices.

tasks_ids.T0372: Establish and collect metrics to monitor and validate cyber workforce readiness including analysis of cyber workforce data to assess the status of positions identified, filled, and filled with qualified personnel.

tasks_ids.T0373: Establish and oversee waiver processes for cyber career field entry and training qualification requirements.

tasks_ids.T0374: Establish cyber career paths to allow career progression, deliberate development, and growth within and between cyber career fields.

tasks_ids.T0375: Establish manpower, personnel, and qualification data element standards to support cyber workforce management and reporting requirements.

tasks_ids.T0376: Establish, resource, implement, and assess cyber workforce management programs in accordance with organizational requirements.

tasks_ids.T0384: Promote awareness of cyber policy and strategy as appropriate among management and ensure sound principles are reflected in the organization's mission, vision, and goals.

tasks_ids.T0387: Review and apply cyber career field qualification standards.

tasks_ids.T0388: Review and apply organizational policies related to or influencing the cyber workforce.

tasks_ids.T0390: Review/Assess cyber workforce effectiveness to adjust skill and/or qualification standards.

tasks_ids.T0391: Support integration of qualified cyber workforce personnel into information systems life cycle development processes.

tasks_ids.T0408: Interpret and apply applicable laws, statutes, and regulatory documents and integrate into policy.

tasks_ids.T0429: Assess policy needs and collaborate with stakeholders to develop policies to govern cyber activities.

tasks_ids.T0437: Correlate training and learning to business or mission requirements.

tasks_ids.T0441: Define and integrate current and future mission environments.

tasks_ids.T0445: Design/integrate a cyber strategy that outlines the vision, mission, and goals that align with the organization's strategic plan.

tasks_ids.T0472: Draft, staff, and publish cyber policy.

tasks_ids.T0481: Identify and address cyber workforce planning and management issues (e.g. recruitment, retention, and training).

tasks_ids.T0505: Monitor the rigorous application of cyber policies, principles, and practices in the delivery of planning and management services.

tasks_ids.T0506: Seek consensus on proposed policy changes from stakeholders.

tasks_ids.T0529: Provide policy guidance to cyber management, staff, and users.

tasks_ids.T0533: Review, conduct, or participate in audits of cyber programs and projects.

tasks_ids.T0536: Serve as an internal consultant and advisor in own area of expertise (e.g., technical, copyright, print media, electronic media).

tasks_ids.T0537: Support the CIO in the formulation of cyber-related policies.

tasks_ids.T0552: Review and approve a supply chain security/risk management policy.
